ANU.name: Elizabeth G Boulton
interest: My Doctorate research investigated the notion of framing climate and environmental change as a threat.  Drawing upon eco-philosopher Timothy Morton's "Hyperobject" notion, it develops the idea that CEC equates to a new type of threat - a hyperthreat. I develop a new conceptual framework for security in the Anthropocene, called 'Entangled Security' and a concept for a 'hyper-response'.I also investigate new approaches to transdiscplinary sense-making, especially the fusion of 'old' and 'new' forms of scholarship, the Humanities and the sciences.

publication.title: Climate change as a hyperobject: a critical review of Timothy Morton
